name: Paul Kim
body:
### About Me:
My name is Paul Kim. I am a Computer Science student enrolled in California State University of Long Beach. I changed my major twice from Mechanical Engineering and Electrical Engineering before becoming a Computer Science major.

### Skills

```
Java
C++
Xilinx
Assembly Language
Javascript
HTML
Microsoft Office
```

### Accomplishments

ACM ICPC Southern California Regional

Fall 2014: 
```
Placement: 49
Team: You Got Hacked!
http://icpc.baylor.edu/regionals/finder/southern-california-2014/standings
```
Although 49 may not be considered impressive, I still believe I can improve. After some reflection, I realized one of the greatest weaknesses of CSULB is the lack of programming exercises that properly integrate advanced algorithms and/ or data structures (AVL, Greedy Algorithm, etc). There is only one absolute solution to this problem: practice. During Summer break of 2015, I will practice past ICPC programming problems from the acm-icpc archive.

My goal for the next ICPC Regional contest in Fall 2015 is to place in the top 35.

### Projects
I developed a stage-clearing Zelda game for my Software Engineering course Fall 2014. This game was developed by two people (myself and Dean Garcia). Unfortunately, our group was the only group that consisted of two students. The link below is a google doc to the JAR file download:

```
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B8o-iCOAupSjbVYwVTliU01tSUk/view?usp=sharing
```

### Tutorial
#### Coming Soon
I will try to upload a series of Java and C++ lectures that will help solidify my understanding of programming while helping others learn.

### Tumblr
Check out my cooking blog at nofacekoh.tumblr.com

### Contact
Contact me at pkim7662@gmail.com if you have any questions.
